title: Synthetic Recap
body:
LOS ANGELES — In a defensive struggle defined by grit and a singular, monumental performance, Hakeem Olajuwon authored a masterpiece for the ages, carrying the Houston Rockets to a bruising 90-85 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.

On a night where points were a premium, Olajuwon was the entire currency. The “Dream” was an unstoppable force, pouring in a game-high 46 points on a remarkable 19-of-32 shooting from the field. He was not merely scoring; he was dominating, adding 13 rebounds to complete his night’s work and anchoring the Rockets’ defense with his presence in the paint.

While Olajuwon operated on a different plane, the Lakers fought valiantly. Shaquille O’Neal, matched up in a marquee center duel, was formidable in his own right, posting a team-high 26 points and hauling in 16 rebounds. Eddie Jones provided crucial support with 23 points, but the Lakers simply had no answer for the Olajuwon onslaught.

The game tightened into a tense, fourth-quarter battle, with each possession carrying the weight of the outcome. Yet, every time the Lakers threatened, Houston went back to its well. Olajuwon answered with a devastating array of post moves, turnaround jumpers, and determined drives to the basket, refusing to let his team falter.

In the end, this was not merely a win for the Houston Rockets; it was a testament to one man’s transcendent talent. On a historic night at the Great Western Forum, Hakeem Olajuwon didn’t just win a game—he took it over, securing a legendary 46-point victory that will be remembered as one of his most dominant individual performances.
